alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 1:41PM PDT until July 31 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the eastern Antelope Valley and adjacent foothills in Los Angeles county. * WHEN...Until 445 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger flooding of roadways and normally dry arroyos, including Highway 138 from Littlerock to the San Bernardino county border. There could be potentially dangerous flows across low water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain showers and possible thunderstorms over the eastern Antelope Valley and adjacent foothills. Roadway flooding is expected to occur in the advisory area. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Lake Los Angeles, Wrightwood, Palmdale, Lancaster, Pearblossom, Llano, Littlerock, Valyermo, Saddleback Butte State Park, Highway 138 between Llano and the San Bernardino County line, Angeles Crest Highway between Mount Waterman and Wrightwood and Big Pines. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
